Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fixation Methods for Femoral Neck Fractures

Trial_Design.evidence: an international, multicenter, randomised controlled trial

Participants.evidence: Participants with Garden-I or II femoral neck fractures and adequate preoperative lateral radiographs were included.

Intervention.evidence: comparing sliding hip screws with cannulated screws

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was subsequent arthroplasty within 24 months.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 555 patients, 67 (12.1%) had posterior tilt ≥20°, and 488 (87.9%) had tilt <20°.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients with tilt ≥20° had a higher risk of arthroplasty (22.4% vs. 11.9%; hazard ratio, 2.22; 95% CI, 1.24 to 4.00; p = 0.008).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered with the appropriate trial registry.

Funding.evidence: The study was funded by relevant sources.
